result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

Huber privileges to apply for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell Fontaine Milton

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Terrell Fontaine Milton
Current: 4578 N Teutonia, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 4578 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 12 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 07/11/2022.  
- anger management class
- No contact with TGM

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN.
Justice Point Pretrial Services SUPERVISION Report received and filed.

Defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrell Fontaine Milton appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

22RM024194  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff

Turnover to JusticePoint for level 4 monitoring with all previoulsy ordered conditions of bail to remain the same

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 30 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin under the supervision of Adam Best.
Defense counsel asks the Court to waive defendant's appearance, granted. 
Case in court for bail review hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. Court grants adjournment. Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 30.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with T.G-M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Terrell Fontaine Milton in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
